biological.英释: relating to the natural processes performed by living things

standpoint.英释: a way of thinking about people, situations, ideas etc

passionate.英释: showing or involving very strong feelings of sexual love

persistent.英释: continuing to exist or happen, especially for longer than is usual or desirable

individual.英释: a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in

specialize.英释: to limit all or most of your study, business etc to a particular subject or activity

mainstream.英释: the most usual ideas or methods, or the people who have these ideas or methods

upbringing.英释: the way that your parents care for you and teach you to behave when you are growing up

confidence.英释: the feeling that you can trust someone or something to be good, work well, or produce good results

generosity.英释: a generous attitude, or generous behaviour

convenient.英释: useful to you because it saves you time, or does not spoil your plans or cause you problems

technician.英释: someone whose job is to check equipment or machines and make sure that they are working properly

worthwhile.英释: if something is worthwhile, it is important or useful, or you gain something from it

consistent.英释: always behaving in the same way or having the same attitudes, standards etc – usually used to show approval

ingredient.英释: one of the foods that you use to make a particular food or dish

particular.中释: 特别的，特指的；讲究的；挑剔的，吹毛求疵的
particular.英释: a particular thing or person is the one that you are talking about, and not any other

convincing.英释: making you believe that something is true or right

simplicity.英释: the quality of being simple and not complicated, especially when this is attractive or useful

enrollment.英释: the number of people who have arranged to join a school, university, course etc

overcharge.英释: to charge someone too much money for something

department.英释: one of the groups of people who work together in a particular part of a large organization such as a hospital, university, company, or government

separately.英释: If people or things are dealt with separately or do something separately, they are dealt with or do something at different times or places, rather than together

accessible.英释: someone who is accessible is easy to meet and talk to, even if they are very important or powerful

widespread.英释: existing or happening in many places or situations, or among many people

democratic.英释: controlled by representatives who are elected by the people of a country

diplomatic.英释: relating to or involving the work of diplomats

inadequate.英释: not good enough, big enough, skilled enough etc for a particular purpose

previously.英释: Previously means at some time before the period that you are talking about

retirement.英释: when you stop working, usually because of your age

assignment.英释: a piece of work that a student is asked to do

preference.英释: if you have a preference for something, you like it more than another thing and will choose it if you can

reputation.英释: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past

competitor.英释: a person, team, company etc that is competing with another

literature.中释: 文学，文学作品；文献；文献
literature.英释: books, plays, poems etc that people think are important and good

consultant.英释: someone whose job is to give advice on a particular subject

innovation.英释: the introduction of new ideas or methods

additional.英释: more than what was agreed or expected

hospitable.英释: friendly, welcoming, and generous to visitors

refreshing.英释: A refreshing bath or drink makes you feel energetic or cool again after you have been tired or hot

profitable.英释: producing a profit or a useful result

phenomenon.英释: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand

appearance.英释: the way someone or something looks to other people

optimistic.英释: believing that good things will happen in the future

resistance.英释: fighting against someone who is attacking you

compensate.英释: to replace or balance the effect of something bad

complement.英释: to make a good combination with someone or something else

anticipate.英释: to expect that something will happen and be ready for it

assumption.英释: something that you think is true although you have no definite proof

unintended.英释: Unintended results were not planned to happen, although they happened

conscience.英释: the part of your mind that tells you whether what you are doing is morally right or wrong

creativity.英释: the ability to use your imagination to produce new ideas, make things etc

motivation.英释: eagerness and willingness to do something without needing to be told or forced to do it

inevitable.英释: certain to happen and impossible to avoid

initiative.英释: if you have or take the initiative, you are in a position to control a situation and decide what to do next

atmosphere.英释: the feeling that an event or place gives you

evaluation.英释: a judgment about how good, useful, or successful something is

incredible.英释: too strange to be believed, or very difficult to believe

instrument.英释: a small tool used in work such as science or medicine

exhibition.英释: a show of paintings, photographs, or other objects that people can go to see

attendance.英释: the number of people who attend a game, concert, meeting etc

accomplish.英释: to succeed in doing something, especially after trying very hard

foundation.英释: the solid layer of  cement  , bricks, stones etc that is put under a building to support it

engagement.英释: an agreement between two people to marry, or the period of time they are engaged

definition.英释: a phrase or sentence that says exactly what a word, phrase, or idea means

persuasion.英释: the act of persuading someone to do something

exaggerate.英释: to make something seem better, larger, worse etc than it really is

vocabulary.英释: all the words that someone knows or uses

illustrate.英释: to make the meaning of something clearer by giving examples

equivalent.英释: having the same value, purpose, job etc as a person or thing of a different kind

prosperity.英释: when people have money and everything that is needed for a good life

sufficient.英释: as much as is needed for a particular purpose

stereotype.英释: a belief or idea of what a particular type of person or thing is like. Stereotypes are often unfair or untrue.

revolution.英释: a complete change in ways of thinking, methods of working etc

statistics.英释: quantitative data on any subject, esp data comparing the distribution of some quantity for different subclasses of the population

appreciate.英释: used to thank someone in a polite way or to say that you are grateful for something they have done

invariably.英释: if something invariably happens or is invariably true, it always happens or is true

nutritious.英释: food that is nutritious is full of the natural substances that your body needs to stay healthy or to grow properly

constantly.英释: all the time, or very often

unbearable.英释: too unpleasant, painful, or annoying to deal with

commitment.英释: a promise to do something or to behave in a particular way

distribute.英释: to share things among a group of people, especially in a planned way

temptation.英释: a strong desire to have or do something even though you know you should not

disservice.英释: If you do someone or something a disservice, you harm them in some way

accumulate.英释: to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time

ultimately.英释: finally, after everything else has been done or considered

programmer.英释: someone whose job is to write computer programs

admiration.英释: a feeling of great respect and liking for something or someone

generation.英释: all people of about the same age

visibility.英释: the distance it is possible to see, especially when this is affected by weather conditions

distracted.英释: anxious and unable to think clearly

substitute.英释: to use something new or diffe-rent instead of something else

inadequacy.英释: the fact of not being good enough in quality, ability, size etc for a particular purpose

facilitate.英释: To facilitate an action or process, especially one that you would like to happen, means to make it easier or more likely to happen

constitute.英释: if several people or things constitute something, they are the parts that form it

aggressive.中释: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
aggressive.英释: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

discourage.英释: to make something less likely to happen

forefinger.英释: the finger next to your thumb

background.英释: someone’s family, education, previous work etc

perception.英释: Perception is the recognition of things using your senses, especially the sense of sight

proportion.英释: A proportion of a group or an amount is a part of it

undervalue.英释: to think that someone or something is less important or valuable than they really are

conclusion.英释: something you decide after considering all the information you have

contribute.英释: to give money, help, ideas etc to something that a lot of other people are also involved in

accelerate.英释: if a process accelerates or if something accelerates it, it happens faster than usual or sooner than you expect

investment.中释: 投资， 投资额； 投入
investment.英释: the use of money to get a profit or to make a business activity successful, or the money that is used

journalist.中释: 新闻工作者， 新闻记者
journalist.英释: someone who writes news reports for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio

commission.英释: to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

horsepower.英释: a unit for measuring the power of an engine, or the power of an engine measured like this

invitation.中释: 邀请， 招待； 请柬； 吸引， 诱惑
invitation.英释: a written or spoken request to someone, inviting them to go somewhere or do something

indication.中释: 指示， 表示， 表明； 象征， 迹象
indication.英释: a sign, remark, event etc that shows what is happening, what someone is thinking or feeling, or what is true

protection.英释: when someone or something is protected

succession.中释: 连续； 一连串； 接替， 继任， 继承
succession.英释: the act of taking over an official job or position, or the right to be the next to take it

comparison.中释: 比较， 对照； 比拟， 比喻
comparison.英释: the process of comparing two or more people or things

successive.英释: coming or following one after the other

obligation.英释: a moral or legal duty to do something

industrial.英释: relating to industry or the people working in it

economical.英释: using money, time, goods etc carefully and without wasting any

reflection.中释: 映像， 倒影； 反射； 反映， 表达； 非议； 沉思， 反省
reflection.英释: an image that you can see in a mirror, glass, or water

convention.中释: 习俗， 惯例； 公约； 会议
convention.英释: a formal agreement, especially between countries, about particular rules or behaviour

philosophy.中释: 哲学， 哲理， 人生哲学
philosophy.英释: the study of the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil, etc

preventive.英释: intended to stop something you do not want to happen, such as illness, from happening

accidental.英释: happening without being planned or intended

possession.中释: 有， 所有； 所有物
possession.英释: if something is in your possession, you own it, or you have obtained it from somewhere

repeatedly.中释: 一再， 再三， 多次地

compassion.英释: a strong feeling of sympathy for someone who is suffering, and a desire to help them

parliament.英释: the group of people who are elected to make a country’s laws and discuss important national affairs

enthusiasm.中释: 热情， 热心， 热忱； 巨大兴趣
enthusiasm.英释: a strong feeling of interest and enjoyment about something and an eagerness to be involved in it

honourable.中释: 光荣的； 可敬的； 正直的
honourable.英释: an honourable action or activity deserves respect and admiration

accountant.英释: someone whose job is to keep and check financial accounts, calculate taxes etc

conviction.中释: 确信； 坚定的信仰； 说服， 信服； 定罪， 判罪
conviction.英释: a very strong belief or opinion

acceptance.中释: 接受； 承认； 容忍
acceptance.英释: when you officially agree to take something that you have been offered

relativity.英释: the relationship in  physics  between time, space, and movement according to Einstein’s  theory

plantation.英释: a large area of land in a hot country, where crops such as tea, cotton, and sugar are grown

permission.中释: 允许， 许可， 准许
permission.英释: If someone who has authority over you gives you permission to do something, they say that they will allow you to do it

invincible.中释: 不能征服的， 无敌的
invincible.英释: too strong to be destroyed or defeated

navigation.中释: 航行， 航海， 航空； 导航， 领航
navigation.英释: the science or job of planning which way you need to go when you are travelling from one place to another

impression.英释: the opinion or feeling you have about someone or something because of the way they seem

comparable.中释: 可比较的； 类似的； 比得上的
comparable.英释: similar to something else in size, number, quality etc, so that you can make a comparison

presumably.中释: 大概， 可能， 据推测
presumably.英释: used to say that you think something is probably true

continuous.中释: 连续不断的； 延伸的
continuous.英释: continuing to happen or exist without stopping

regardless.中释: 不顾后果地； 不管怎样， 无论如何
regardless.英释: without being affected or influenced by something

millimetre.英释: a unit for measuring length. There are 1,000 millimetres in one metre.

specialist.英释: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, or is very skilled at it

leadership.英释: the position of being the leader of a group, organization, country etc

impressive.英释: something that is impressive makes you admire it because it is very good, large, important etc

attraction.中释: 吸引， 吸引力； 引力； 具有吸引力的事物
attraction.英释: a feature or quality that makes something seem interesting or enjoyable

procession.英释: a line of people or vehicles moving slowly as part of a ceremony

expression.中释: 词语； 表达； 表情
expression.英释: something you say, write, or do that shows what you think or feel

collection.中释: 搜集， 聚集， 积聚； 收集， 收取； 收藏品， 收集的东西
collection.英释: the act of obtaining money that is owed to you

laboratory.英释: a special room or building in which a scientist does tests or prepares substances

politician.英释: someone who works in politics, especially an elected member of the government

artificial.中释: 人工的， 人为的； 矫揉造作的； 模拟的
artificial.英释: not real or not made of natural things but made to be like something that is real or natural

profession.中释: 职业； 声明， 表白
profession.英释: A profession is a type of job that requires advanced education or training

calculator.英释: a small electronic machine that can add, multiply etc

underneath.英释: the bottom surface of something, or the part of something that is below or under something else

republican.英释: someone who believes in government by elected representatives only, with no king or queen

mysterious.英释: mysterious events or situations are difficult to explain or understand

collective.英释: a group of people who work together to run something such as a business or farm, and who share the profits equally

sympathize.中释: 同情， 怜悯； 体谅； 赞同
sympathize.英释: to feel sorry for someone because you understand their problems

preferable.中释: 更可取的， 更好的， 更合意的

scientific.英释: about or related to science, or using its methods

membership.中释: 会员身份， 会籍； 全体会员， 会员数
membership.英释: when someone is a member of a club, group, or organization

ambassador.中释: 大使， 使节， 派驻国际组织的代表
ambassador.英释: an important official who represents his or her government in a foreign country

resolution.中释: 正式决定， 决议； 决心， 决意； 解决， 解答； 分辨率， 清晰度
resolution.英释: a formal decision or statement agreed on by a group of people, especially after a vote

persuasive.中释: 劝诱的； 有说服力的
persuasive.英释: able to make other people believe something or do what you ask

historical.中释: 历史的， 有关历史的

repetition.英释: doing or saying the same thing many times

microphone.中释: 扩音器， 话筒， 麦克风
microphone.英释: a piece of equipment that you speak into to record your voice or make it louder when you are speaking or performing in public

typewriter.英释: a machine with keys that you press in order to print letters of the alphabet onto paper

arithmetic.英释: the science of numbers involving adding, multiplying etc

curriculum.英释: the subjects that are taught by a school, college etc, or the things that are studied in a particular subject

internship.中释: 实习生身份； 实习医师期
internship.英释: a job that lasts for a short time, that someone, especially a student, does in order to gain experience

correspond.中释: 相符合， 相当； 通信
correspond.英释: if two things or ideas correspond, the parts or information in one relate to the parts or information in the other

applicable.中释: 能应用的； 合适的， 适当的
applicable.英释: if something is applicable to a particular person, group, or situation, it affects them or is related to them

respective.中释: 各自的， 各个的， 分别的
respective.英释: used before a plural noun to refer to the different things that belong to each separate person or thing mentioned

employment.中释: 工作； 雇用； 使用
employment.英释: the condition of having a paid job

concession.中释: 让步， 妥协； 特许， 特许权； 承认， 认可
concession.英释: something that you allow someone to have in order to end an argument or a disagreement

accusation.英释: a statement saying that someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something wrong

centimetre.英释: a unit for measuring length. There are 100 centimetres in one metre.

helicopter.英释: a type of aircraft with large metal blades on top which turn around very quickly to make it fly

thoughtful.英释: always thinking of the things you can do to make people happy or comfortable

occasional.中释: 偶尔的， 间或发生的
occasional.英释: happening sometimes but not often or regularly

spacecraft.英释: a vehicle that is able to travel in space

attractive.中释: 有吸引力的， 引起注意的
attractive.英释: someone who is attractive is good looking, especially in a way that makes you sexually interested in them

percentage.英释: an amount expressed as if it is part of a total which is 100

limitation.中释: 限制， 限度； 局限
limitation.英释: the act or process of controlling or reducing something

unexpected.英释: used to describe something that is surprising because you were not expecting it

microscope.英释: a scientific instrument that makes extremely small things look larger

depression.中释: 抑郁， 沮丧； 不景气， 萧条； 洼地， 凹陷
depression.英释: the period during the 1930s when there was not much business activity and not many jobs

conversely.英释: used when one situation is the opposite of another

popularity.中释: 普及， 流行； 声望
popularity.英释: when something or someone is liked or supported by a lot of people

subsequent.英释: happening or coming after something else

popularize.英释: to make a difficult subject or idea able to be easily understood by ordinary people who have no special knowledge about it

precaution.中释: 预防； 防备， 警惕
precaution.英释: something you do in order to prevent something dangerous or unpleasant from happening

management.中释: 管理； 处理； 管理部门； 管理人员
management.英释: the activity of controlling and organizing the work that a company or organization does

mechanical.中释: 机械的， 机械制造的； 机械学的， 力学的； 呆板的

supplement.英释: to add something, especially to what you earn or eat, in order to increase it to an acceptable level

occurrence.中释: 发生， 出现； 发生的事件

settlement.中释: 解决； 协议； 居留地
settlement.英释: an official agreement or decision that ends an argument, a court case, or a fight, or the action of making an agreement

suggestion.中释: 建议， 意见； 细微的迹象； 暗示
suggestion.英释: an idea, plan, or possibility that someone mentions, or the act of mentioning it

systematic.中释: 有系统的， 有计划的

greenhouse.英释: a glass building used for growing plants that need warmth, light, and protection

favourable.中释: 有利的， 赞成的； 顺利的
favourable.英释: suitable and likely to make something happen or succeed

medication.英释: medicine or drugs given to people who are ill

respondent.中释: 回答者； 响应者； 被告
respondent.英释: someone who has to defend their own case in a law court, especially in a  divorce  case

discipline.中释: 训练； 惩罚， 处罚
discipline.英释: to punish someone in order to keep order and control

strengthen.英释: to become stronger or make something stronger

recreation.英释: an activity that you do for pleasure or amusement

conference.中释: 会议， 讨论会； 讨论， 商谈
conference.英释: a large formal meeting where a lot of people discuss important matters such as business, politics, or science, especially for several days

commercial.中释: 商业的， 商务的； 商品化的， 商业性的
commercial.英释: related to business and the buying and selling of goods and services

reasonable.中释: 通情达理的， 讲道理的； 合理的； 公道的； 尚好的， 过得去的

coordinate.英释: one of a set of numbers which give the exact position of a point on a map, computer screen etc

remarkable.中释: 值得注意的， 引人注目的； 异常的， 非凡的
remarkable.英释: unusual or surprising and therefore deserving attention or praise

technology.中释: 工艺学； 工艺， 技术
technology.英释: new machines, equipment, and ways of doing things that are based on modern knowledge about science and computers

compromise.英释: an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement

connection.中释: 联系， 关系； 连接， 衔接； 连贯性； 熟人， 关系
connection.英释: the way in which two facts, ideas, events etc are related to each other, and one is affected or caused by the other

efficiency.中释: 效率； 功效， 效能
efficiency.英释: the quality of doing something well and effectively, without wasting time, money, or energy

innovative.英释: an innovative idea or way of doing something is new, different, and better than those that existed before

centigrade.英释: Centigrade is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °C.

inhabitant.英释: one of the people who live in a particular place

earthquake.英释: a sudden shaking of the earth’s surface that often causes a lot of damage

excitement.中释: 刺激， 激动， 兴奋； 令人兴奋的事， 刺激的因素

fertilizer.英释: a substance that is put on the soil to make plants grow

responsive.中释: 响应的； 敏感的， 易受影响的
responsive.英释: reacting quickly, in a positive way

population.英释: the number of people living in a particular area, country etc

downstairs.英释: be situated on the ground floor of a building or on a lower floor than you are

complicate.英释: to make a problem or situation more difficult

conversion.英释: when you change something from one form, purpose, or system to a different one

throughout.英释: during all of a particular period, from the beginning to the end

experiment.英释: a scientific test done to find out how something reacts under certain conditions, or to find out if a particular idea is true

difficulty.英释: if you have difficulty doing something, it is difficult for you to do

Fahrenheit.英释: a scale of temperature in which water freezes at 32˚ and boils at 212˚

acceptable.英释: good enough to be used for a particular purpose or to be considered satisfactory

blackboard.英释: a board with a dark smooth surface, used in schools for writing on with  chalk

especially.英释: used to emphasize that something is more important or happens more with one particular thing than with others

delegation.英释: a group of people who represent a company, organization etc

inspection.英释: an official visit to a building or organization to check that everything is satisfactory and that rules are being obeyed

impossible.英释: something that is impossible cannot happen or be done

difference.英释: a way in which two or more people or things are not like each other

basketball.英释: a game played indoors between two teams of five players, in which each team tries to win points by throwing a ball through a net

production.英释: the process of making or growing things to be sold, especially in large quantities

dictionary.英释: a book that gives a list of words in alphabetical order and explains their meanings in the same language, or another language

lieutenant.英释: a fairly low rank in the armed forces, or an officer of this rank

correction.英释: a change made in something in order to make it right or better

playground.英释: an area for children to play, especially at a school or in a park, that often has special equipment for climbing on, riding on etc

altogether.英释: used to emphasize that something has been done completely or has finished completely

government.英释: the group of people who govern a country or state

disappoint.英释: to make someone feel unhappy because something they hoped for did not happen or was not as good as they expected

transistor.英释: a small piece of electronic equipment in radios, televisions etc that controls the flow of electricity

suspicious.英释: thinking that someone might be guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

Australian.英释: relating to Australia or its people

photograph.英释: a picture obtained by using a camera and film that is sensitive to light

headmaster.英释: a male teacher who is in charge of a school

eventually.英释: after a long time, or after a lot of things have happened

automation.英释: the use of computers and machines instead of people to do a job

experience.英释: knowledge or skill that you gain from doing a job or activity, or the process of doing this

structural.英释: connected with the structure of something
